character.name: Quintus Sanguinarius Horatius
character.symbolic_representation: The Pale Horse (Death, Pestilence, Terror, Dehumanization)
character.brief_description: A brutal enforcement officer whose efficiency in cruelty masks progressive dehumanization, becoming Rome's tool while losing his own humanity.
character.full_description: Horatius is a Roman enforcement officer and interrogator known for absolute obedience and effectiveness in harsh measures. He appears as a necessary enforcer doing Rome's dirty work, but beneath this appearance lies a man becoming progressively dehumanized. Every cruelty he inflicts costs him a piece of humanity. Every order he follows without question hardens him further. His arc isn't about revelation of hidden natureâ€”it's about transformation into something inhuman. By Part 3, he must choose between complete dehumanization or reclaiming his humanity, but either outcome is devastating.
character.occupation: Roman enforcement officer, interrogator, administrator of harsh measures
character.opening_state: Controlled brutality; effective enforcement; feared; already dehumanized
character.key_transformation: Psychological strain visible; compartmentalization breaking; awareness of dehumanization growing
character.closing_state: Either broken and no longer functional, re-hardened more brutally, or defected/turned toward followers
character.arc_preview: From efficient brutal tool coordinating with other Horsemen, through escalating brutality and psychological breakdown, to final choice between complete dehumanization or reclaiming humanity
